author: Special Correspondent
text:
At a time when the country is becoming the cardiac disease capital of the world, the need of the hour is to use all capabilities to take up prevention, said H.K. Chopra, president of the Cardiology Society of India.

Inaugurating the three-day annual conference here on Wednesday, Dr. Chopra said the best way to tackle the current crisis was to take the digital route.

He suggested that a smart app on how to prevent heart attacks and how to reduce hypertension be created.

According to him, the specialists should create a road map to make prevention their motto.

By 2025, the Society should aim at reducing the cardiovascukar disease mortality by 25 per cent, he said.

His suggestion to cardiologists was to spend time with patients telling them about healthy lifestyle and exercise.

Pratap C. Reddy, founder chairman of Apollo group of hospitals said cardiologists should work with the 5,00,000 general physicians in the country to raise awareness about the seriousness of cardiac diseases that cut life short.

If cardiologists, the civil society and the government did not act soon, cardiac ailments could grow by 15 to 20 per cent by 2020, he warned.

The Society honoured two cardiologists with life-time achievement awards and released three books on cardiac care.
title: Digital route to prevent heart disease mooted
